content.text: "Build a complete, Notion-style rich text editor in Next.js using the Novel editor package with Tiptap. Include features for headings (H1–H6),ask ai ,  paragraphs, bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, bullet lists, numbered lists, block quotes, code blocks, inline code, checklists, tables, images with captions, and slash commands for quick insertion. Integrate Novel’s AI autocompletion for writing assistance. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and ensure the editor is fully responsive. The code must be modular, extensible, and maintainable, following best practices for scalability in a future full-featured notes and documentation app.

*"Design the frontend architecture for a scalable Notion-like notes and documentation web application using Next.js. The architecture must follow a modular, component-driven structure with small, reusable, and self-contained UI components. Use the Context API (or lightweight state management) for global state handling, ensuring easy communication and synchronization between components.

Follow a user-first approach — any user action (create, update, delete, reorder, share, etc.) should reflect instantly across the UI via optimistic updates before the API response. Ensure global state is updated in real-time to keep all components in sync without unnecessary re-renders.
Metadata caching in memory for fast rendering of page trees and lists.
Notes content caching in IndexedDB for offline-first capability and reduced API calls.
Auto-sync cached data with backend when online.
Clear folder structure: components/, contexts/, hooks/, pages/, services/, utils/
Context API for pages(each page has unique path differtiate by note id like page[id]) metadata, and editor state.
Custom hooks for data fetching, caching, and optimistic updates.
Error boundaries for robust error handling.
Fully responsive UI with minimal re-renders using memoization.
Scalable and maintainable codebase, ready for adding future modules without major refactors.
Ensure the architecture promotes high performance, maintainability, and a seamless user experience with instant UI feedback and efficient data flow between components.
– UI Theme Design: Notion-Style, Clean & Modular
with soft gray accents and subtle dividing lines.
Sans-serif, airy spacing, consistent font sizing hierarchy.
that feels modular and fluid, matching Notion’s flexible structure.
unless necessary; rely on spacing, shadows, and hover highlights for separation.
that feel identical to Notion on desktop, tablet, and mobile.
— primary interaction states (links, selected blocks, highlights) use a soft, neutral blue.
are flat with subtle hover shading, light shadows, and square/rounded corners consistent with Notion’s style.
: clicking “+” beside a note creates a
, which can also have children, and so on.
Actions on each note via a small icon menu:
Drag & drop reorder within the tree.
Smooth transition on expand/collapse of nested notes.
Supports headings, lists, code blocks, checkboxes, embeds, tables, etc.
Create a root or child page.
After creation → redirect user to new page.
Owner deletes page and all its children (cascading delete).
If shared → user can remove themselves from the share list instead.
Shared users cannot rename; can only remove their access.
Cannot reorder between different categories (Public → Private, etc.).
Fetch top-level pages of tree , filterable by category (Public, Private, Shared, For Approval, Published).
Owner requests admin approval for publishing.
Owner shares page with specific users.
Admin/owner grants or revokes edit/view rights.
Stores uploaded/pasted files and returns a media URL.
– Pages shared with the user (view/edit based on rights).
– Visible only to admins for review.
